text: [Music]
in the context of organizations the
masculinity contest is viewing work as a
dominance contest that you win through
performing masculinity and so it creates
a set of norms and we've measured these
norms within organizations so the norms
have to do with things like showing no
weakness so being the tough guy not
asking questions because that might make
you seem like you don't know the answer
it's also valuing strength and stamina
and putting work first so that it's all
about work and you can't ask for a break
because you have to take care of family
for instance and this creates all sorts
of negative consequences both for the
organization and for the individuals
within the organization especially women
but men too and so it's really when
there's a stalinist contest there are a
few who win and there are many who lose
and and the winners maybe they might win
in some way but the organization itself
loses because it creates organizational
dysfunction
we looked at organizational measures so
things like for instance people who said
in my work environment it has these
aspects of the things we call the
masculinity contest they were much more
likely to report that their immediate
supervisor was a toxic leader they were
much more likely to report that the
environment includes bullying gender
harassment sexual harassment ethnic
harassment and then at the personal
level personal outcomes they were
reporting higher job burnout less
organizational dedication more of an
intention to leave in the next three
years and lower psychological health
my talk I use uber as an example they've
been in the news a lot lately there's
been a lot of scandals gender sexual
harassment
lack of diversity in their workforce
illegal behavior and Scruton and all of
this has really added up to being very
dysfunctional and they recognize that
there is a problem and they have named
their problem they've named the problem
as it's because we tolerate and we
prefer what they call brilliant jerks
and the jerk part is really what is bred
by the masculinity contest you know if
that's what it takes to win at work you
really have to be a jerk you know you
really have to look at what what the the
organizational culture is and it has to
be from the top down I mean it really
and there's part of the problem maybe
the leaders have kind of emerged through
this contest and it's not you know I
mean women are hampered in this contest
but you know but the women who survive
and go up the ladder have really somehow
adopted or adapted to it so it's hard
because you really need the leadership
to realize that this is hurting the
organization and and really to encourage
behaviors that are not about promoting
me and me achieving me winning but
really about promoting the
organization's what's been in the best
interest of the organization and
promoting teamwork and rewarding that
rewarding those behaviors and also
looking at things not at the surface but
really trying to dig down well who
really is making a contribution and and
valuing those contributions and
revealing those because it's really kind
of the squeaky wheel right the person
who self promotes in those environments
that gets ahead
